snippet: Those in New York City looking to take photographs of the so-called supermoon had to make do with other amusements under a cloudy sky on Saturday night.
abstract: Cloudy New York City skies obscure views of the so-called supermoon over the weekend, phenomenon that occurs once a year when the Moon is full and in a closer-than-normal orbit to earth. (M)
lead_paragraph: There was talk of king tides and supermoons, enough to bring the curious to the shores of New York City on Saturday night. Some came with cameras, others with liquid refreshments. Some walked along the beach, while others chose higher ground. And still others saw it as an opportunity.

headline.main: Obscured, 'Supermoon' Still Leaves Plenty to See
